notesStmt.note: Manuscript description based on Margoliouth, G.: Catalogue of the Hebrew and Samaritan Manuscripts in the British Museum, London 1965.

msItem.title: Perush ῾al Sifre ha-higayon shel Aristo פרוש על ספרי ההגיון של אריסטו

collation.p: Quires of mostly 12 leaves each, marked by a signature on the first page and partly by catchwords at the end.

scriptDesc.scriptNote: Sefardi cursive and semi-curive scripts of the 15th century.

binding.p: Post-1600. Dark brown leather, blind tooled, with Sloane's coat of arms on the upper cover. Boxed. Bound together with Sloane 3030. Spine: 'Aristotelis. Varia. Hebraice. Mus. Brit. Bibl. Sloan. 3030 or 3265. Plut. CII. D.'

history.provenance: Acquisition: Sir Hans Sloane: baronet, physician and collector (b. 1660, d. 1753): in his collection; acquired by the British Museum in 1753.
